rules for the game
1. Play to win, not to lose-this should be obvious, do not purposely let your team down
2. Do not quote or screenshot ANY PMs I send you, this includes role PMs and any discussions I have, doing so will result in a modkill
3. Once a post is made, do not edit it even if you have the ability to do so, you can't take back what you say IRL easily, so why would you be able to do it here?
4. No text encryption, hard-to-read fonts or any other means of hiding text from other players
5. Dead means dead, once you die you are not allowed to post in this thread at all, sorry to those that like to make "bah!" posts but that is not allowed this game
6. Unless the role I give you says so, you may not talk to anyone in this game outside of this thread
7. I don't mind a little bit of heated discussion, but if there are ANY personal attacks, flaming, insults and poor sportsmanship will result in a warning, a second offence and...*pulls gun out and shoots in the air* you get the idea (Mod-kill)
8. Rule 8 about ongoing games, do not talk about ongoing games outside of their own threads, doing so is an instant force-replacement or mod-kill

9. Day phases last for 2 weeks, night phases last 48 hours
10. Even though a hammer has been made, players can continue to talk during the twilight phase, INCLUDING the player to be lynched
11. If I don't receive a night action before the deadline, you will not be able to take any action that night
12. In the event you can't post during a night phase, feel free to PM me the action you wish performed the night before
13. I will extend the deadline if events mean it is necessary, not because players request it
14. Please use either the bold tag or vote tag when voting, nicknames are fine providing I can easily determine a player's name, votes would look like this, vote: kelbris or VOTE: kelbris
15. Unvotes are helpful, but do not worry if you don't do one as they are not mandatory
16. No sneaky stuff relating to votes, if it looks like a vote, I will count it as one
17. A player will only be lynched if over half the players vote for him/her, I shall indicate the amount of votes needed for a hammer in each VC
18. If there is not a majority by the end of a day, that day ends in a no-lynch
19. Once a player is destined for the noose, NOTHING can change their terrible fate
20. Some other votes include vote: no lynch to end the day without a kill (requires a majority of players) and vote: draw to end the game in a draw which must be agreed upon by ALL remaining players

21. You must post at least once every 48 hours or you will be prodded
22. If you do not post within 24 hours of receiving a prod, you will be replaced, same applies if you are prodded more then 3 times
23. If you know you will be unable to participate for a few days, let me know via PM or in the thread so I don't prod you without reason
24. If you see any errors with my VC, deadlines or anything else please let me know so I can correct them
25. I shall not answer any role-specific questions in-thread, if you have a question about your role please send them via PM, I will not answer questions about the roles of other players at all, no trickery in an attempt to fool me into revealing a role will be tolerated and will result in an immediate MK
26. If you need to get my attention, please use @mod or @kelbris in your post, using bold is preferred
27. If you have any complaints about another player, send them to me via PM and I will do my best to resolve the situation
28. If I need to MK someone during the day, that day ends immediately to keep the flow of the game

29. I use the color red, DO NOT USE IT
30. Flavor text is NOT relevant to the game, analyze it and you could find yourself suffering a terrible fate
31. I will not MK, force-replace or do anything to a player just because someone asks me to, I make the calls in that regard, no-one else
32. As moderator, my word is final, please respect my decisions and instructions
33. I reserve the right to change these rules at any time if necessary, if this happens I shall notify everyone of the rule change in-thread
34. All site-wide rules apply as well as the above rules
35. You can not claim a color as your own
36. I live in Australia, my time zone is Australian Eastern Standard Time

sample VT role PM
welcome [insert player name here], you are a Vanilla Townie.

this means that during the day you can vote and talk with other players, during the night you go to sleep and therefore can do nothing.

You shall win when every threat to the town is eliminated and at least one town player remains standing.

The game thread is located here, please confirm by responding with your role name to this PM.

all role PMs have been sent, once most of the players confirm, the game shall begin.

And...let the game BEGIN!!!

Day 1 has now begun, the deadline will be 29/4/15 at 9am UTC+10

the day ends in (expired on 2015-04-29 09:00:00)

Well I don't, either, and I agree with your sig. But I think we all recognize that a certain amount of appealing to meta is normal and can be beneficial in supporting arguments if used in the right way. Although arguments based solely on meta are right out. One of my biggest pet peeves in this game (in my whole 4 games (including this one) of experience) is when people ask for examples of meta as evidence of an argument. For example:

Player A: I always do X when Y.
Player B: Can you give me a game link showing how you always do X when Y?
Player A: OK, here you go!
Player B: I see, I guess you were telling the truth.

That's just ridiculously bad, because player A can be totally gaming their statement in advance knowing that they'll be able to cherrypick an example from a prior game to "support" their statement. And furthermore, a single example doesn't prove that Player A "always" does X when Y anyway. And furthermore, just because they "always" did it before doesn't mean they're doing it now.

In such an exchange, I get very suspicious of both player A and player B because A is using such an easily gamed statement, and B asked for what they must know is non-evidence and then accepted it. Feels like a charade meant to imply that B was suspicious of A when they really weren't.

Anyway, this is not particularly relevant to this game at this point, so back to your regularly scheduled programming ...

I don't think Wanderer-nl is a slam dunk here. There are several ways in which Garmr's claim is weird:

1. Why claim immediately on Day 2? Why not wait it out and see if you can get Wanderer-nl lynched normally and stay alive to investigate someone else? This is what I would have done.

2. Why say that you "obviously" won't reveal until everyone has given their guesses, then reveal before that anyway?

3. Why get so upset just because BBT and a few others have questioned your veracity? Didn't you expect that when you made the claim? You should have. And then using being upset like that as an excuse to reveal your target, feels like realizing that you are not as likely to get info out of the guesses as you'd hoped and are more likely to see people waver on believing the claim, so fall back to revealing the target immediately in hopes of getting the day to end before anyone realizes the claim is fake.

4. With a 3/11 chance of targeting correctly, the odds were only slightly better than 25% of targeting a scum. Is Garmr really that lucky?

On the flip side, we have these points in favor of Garmr's claim:

1. If you're going to fake claim and target anyone, why pick Wanderer? She was looking kind of guilty to alot of people after Day 1 and I suspect that scum had a decent chance of maneuvering for a lynch of her without having to fake claim.

2. Why risk a scum slot just to get a single townie lynched? Scum's ahead at this point, with 3 town deaths and no scum deaths thus far. Is a gambit that will sacrifice a scum for a townie worth it? I wouldn't think so.

3. Why would the scum team have Garmr be the one to make the fake cop claim? Garmr was not really on anyone's scum radar, seems it would have been better to select a more scum-read person to fake claim on the assumption that if people were going to believe the fake claim, it would be better to sacrifice someone more likely to be lynched anyway than Garmr.

Oh yeah, add another point in favor of Garmr's claim:

4. Why NK Slandaar and then go after Wanderer with the fake claim? Seems it would have made much more sense to keep Slandaar alive and see if he could help drive a mislynch on Wanderer, than kill him and then fake claim target Wanderer anyway.

Is it possible that scum get two kills per night? If that's the case then I guess it would be a good strategy to trade a scum slot for 5 townies (three the first night, because scum Garmr would live, town Wanderer would die, and scum would kill two more townies, then two the second night, as scum Garmr would be lynched and scum then get to choose two more townie deaths). However, giving scum two kills per night would really unbalance the game in favor of scum I think and so I really doubt the game was set up that way.

May I point out that Garmr is either going to be NK'd tonight, or is going to be lynched tomorrow. Do we lose much by lynching him today? If he's really the cop, he's almost certainly going to die tonight anyway (there is no longer a doctor to protect him, although I suppose there still could be a jailkeeper? But having a doctor + JK + cop on the town team seems overpowered, no?).

We could lynch Wanderer, and then have to lynch Garmr if he fake claimed. But if Garmr real claimed, then we'll get no real info from the NK since it we would know that scum have to kill Garmr.

Or we could lynch Garmr, and then have to lynch Wanderer if Garmr's claim was real. But if Garmr fake claimed, then we'll get a bit more info from the NK since it will be someone other than Wanderer.
